alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 3:01PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... California... West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Douglas and Alpine Counties. .Warm temperatures and snowmelt in the Sierra will continue to result in high flows along the West and East Forks of the Carson River. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...West Fork Carson River At Woodfords. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Minor flooding begins in lowest areas along the West Fork of the Carson River in southwest Carson Valley including agricultural areas, local roads and outbuildings. Impacts will be more significant if heavy rain and/or snowmelt causes significant rises in small creeks draining the east side of the Carson Range below Woodfords. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:05 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 13.4 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov.
